Jeanne, youâ€™re still in the peak shedding windowâ€”your illness and spring stress lined up, so hair is under double pressure right now. Breakfast is your â€œbig dominoâ€ because it sets the cortisol curve for the day and gives iron + protein early, which your survey shows can be low. A steady morning meal helps slow active loss and nudges your body toward stabilization sooner. ğŸŒ±

What to do

  • Eat within 60â€“90 min of waking to anchor your body clock.
  • Aim for ~25â€“30g protein + iron-rich food (vegan or omnivore).
  • Keep it fast: 5-min builds, minimal prep, repeatable favorites.
  • Balance with a slow carb or fruit to keep blood sugar calm.

Your plan

  • Omnivore option: 2 scrambled eggs + spinach + black beans; or turkey wrap with hummus.
  • Vegan option: Tofu scramble with veggies + pumpkin seeds; or smoothie with pea protein, oats, and frozen berries.
  • Iron-booster: pair with vitamin C (citrus, peppers) for better absorption.

Step-by-step implementation

  1. Set out one or two â€œdefaultâ€ breakfasts you likeâ€”no overthinking when stress is high.
  2. Prep staples the night before (soaked oats, chopped greens, or boiled eggs).
  3. If appetite is low, start with half servingâ€”consistency matters more than size.
  4. Replace your 12â€“3pm caffeine jolt with a protein-rich snack if you feel energy dipâ€”keeps afternoon cortisol smoother.
  5. Log protein grams for 3â€“4 days until you can â€œeyeballâ€ ~25â€“30g easily.

Why this works (for you)

  • Front-loading protein + iron gives your follicles the building blocks they need for regrowth once shedding slows.
  • A morning meal blunts the stress hormone spike; with your moderate stress history, this helps transition from peak shedding toward stabilization.
  • Your past iron deficiency risk + slight PMS symptoms suggest keeping ferritin steady is keyâ€”early iron-rich meals help most.
  • Because illness ended in late Sept, hair shifts can still worsen for 2â€“3 months; this breakfast habit shortens that lag and cues your body sooner toward repair.

What to look out for

  • Red flags: Skipping breakfast, relying only on coffee, or skipping protein â†’ more energy dips + prolonged shedding pressure.
  • Green lights: Smoother energy mid-morning, less urge for caffeine, steadier mood within 7â€“10 days.
  • â¤ï¸ Be gentle with yourselfâ€”this isnâ€™t about perfection, itâ€™s about building one anchor habit that tells your body: safety, fuel, and time to heal.
week3.practice1_title: Practice 1: Win Your Day with Breakfast
